description: Generated when the finite state machine of a control protocol
(LCP, LQR, etc.) reaches the OPENED state.

event.Summary: Finite state machine of control protocol reached opened state

description: The tmnxPppCpState variable indicates the current state
of the PPP Control Protocol on this interface.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PPP-MIB::tmnxPppCpState

description: Generated when the finite state machine of a control protocol
(LCP, LQR, etc.) leaves the OPENED state.

event.Summary: Finite state machine of control protocol leaves opened state

description: The tmnxPppCpState variable indicates the current state
of the PPP Control Protocol on this interface.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PPP-MIB::tmnxPppCpState

description: Generated when the finite state machine of a network control protocol
(IPCP, MPLSCP, BCP, OSICP, etc.) reaches the OPENED state.

event.Summary: Finite state machine of network control protocol reached opened state

description: The tmnxPppCpState variable indicates the current state
of the PPP Control Protocol on this interface.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PPP-MIB::tmnxPppCpState

description: Generated when the finite state machine of a network control protocol
(IPCP, MPLSCP, BCP, OSICP, etc.) leaves the OPENED state.

event.Summary: Finite state machine of network control protocol leaves opened state

description: The tmnxPppCpState variable indicates the current state
of the PPP Control Protocol on this interface.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PPP-MIB::tmnxPppCpState

description: Generated when the keepalive based on echo packets failed.
The value tmnxPppKaPeriod is used to configure the time
interval in seconds at which keepalive requests are issued. When
LQM is enabled by setting tmnxPppQuality equal to some
value other than zero (0), keepalives are replaced with LQR
messages.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PPP-MIB::tmnxPppKaPeriod

description: Generated when the link has failed in meeting the specified
quality percentage.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-PPP-MIB::tmnxPppLqmFailure TIMETRA-PPP-MIB::tmnxPppLqmInRate u 0 TIMETRA-PPP-MIB::tmnxPppLqmOutRate u 0 TIMETRA-PPP-MIB::tmnxPppQuality u 0

description: The average of 'SaveInPackets'/'PeerOutPackets' in the last five
consecutive LQRs received.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PPP-MIB::tmnxPppLqmInRate

description: The average of 'PeerInPackets'/'LastOutPackets' in the last five
consecutive LQRs received.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PPP-MIB::tmnxPppLqmOutRate

description: The value of tmnxPppQuality is a percentage used by LQM to
monitor the link quality. If the quality drops below this
percentage, the router shuts down the link. The percentages
are calculated for both the incoming and outgoing directions.
When LQM is enabled by setting tmnxPppQuality to a non-zero
value, Link Quality Reports (LQRs) are sent, in place of
keepalives, every keepalive period. All incoming keepalives
and/or LQRs are always responded to regardless of the setting
of tmnxPppQuality. A value of zero (0) implies no LQM quality
monitoring and is the only value supported.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PPP-MIB::tmnxPppQuality

description: Generated when the value of tmnxPppLocalMagicNumber is the same as
the value of tmnxPppRemoteMagicNumber sent by the peer.
tmnxPppLocalMagicNumber is the local magic number to be sent to the
peer. The magic number provides a method to detect loopbacks. If the
value of tmnxPppLocalMagicNumber is the same as the value of
tmnxPppRemoteMagicNumber, then it is possible that the link might
be looped back. If the two magic numbers do not match, then the link
is not looped back.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PPP-MIB::tmnxPppLocalMagicNumber

description: tmnxPppRemoteMagicNumber is the magic number sent by the peer.
If the value of tmnxPppRemoteMagicNumber is the same as the value of
tmnxPppLocalMagicNumber, then it is possible that the link might
be looped back. If the two magic numbers do not match, then the link
is not looped back.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PPP-MIB::tmnxPppRemoteMagicNumber

description: Generated when the loopback condition is cleared. It means that the
value of tmnxPppLocalMagicNumber is different than
the value of tmnxPppRemoteMagicNumber sent by the peer.
tmnxPppLocalMagicNumber is the local magic number to be sent to the
peer. The magic number provides a method to detect loopbacks. If the
value of tmnxPppLocalMagicNumber is the same as the value of
tmnxPppRemoteMagicNumber, then it is possible that the link might
be looped back. If the two magic numbers do not match, then the link
is not looped back.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PPP-MIB::tmnxPppLocalMagicNumber

description: tmnxPppRemoteMagicNumber is the magic number sent by the peer.
If the value of tmnxPppRemoteMagicNumber is the same as the value of
tmnxPppLocalMagicNumber, then it is possible that the link might
be looped back. If the two magic numbers do not match, then the link
is not looped back.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PPP-MIB::tmnxPppRemoteMagicNumber
